messages.subject: Re: New NoSpanking email list
messages.msgSnippet: ...  wrote: Pam, I just wanted to say that this is so nice of you to do for the people that have a problem with spanking. To take your time
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com, Pamela Sorooshian
<pamsoroosh@m...> wrote:


Pam, I just wanted to say that this is so nice of you to do for the
people that have a problem with spanking. To take your time and offer
help to this situation and help children is the nicest thing I've
seen. Good luck with your new list.

Kim


>>Introducing a new email discussion list,
"NoSpanking@yahoogroups.com"
The list is owned and moderated by Pam Sorooshian, homeschooling mom
of three children, ages 18, 15, and 12.

List description:

The purpose of the NoSpanking list is support for parents who wish to
discover and utilize alternatives to spanking their children. This
list is not for debating, but is for providing help, information,
ideas, and encouragement for those who prefer not to use corporal
punishment on their children. The official policy of this list is
that
punishment of children is not necessary and that alternative
nonpunitive ways of relating to children are preferred.
Questions and suggestions and support are welcome from parents, no
matter what their parenting philosophies or practices, but this is
not
the place for argumentative posts in favor spanking.
To subscribe, send a blank email to
NoSpanking-subscribe@yahoo

Introducing a new email discussion list, "NoSpanking@yahoogroups.com."
The list is owned and moderated by Pam Sorooshian, homeschooling mom of
three children, ages 18, 15, and 12.

List description:

The purpose of the NoSpanking list is support for parents who wish to
discover and utilize alternatives to spanking their children. This list
is not for debating, but is for providing help, information, ideas, and
encouragement for those who prefer not to use corporal punishment on
their children.

The official policy of this list is that punishment of children is not
necessary and that alternative nonpunitive ways of relating to children
are preferred.

Questions and suggestions and support are welcome from parents, no
matter what their parenting philosophies or practices, but this is not
the place for argumentative posts in favor spanking.

To subscribe, send a blank email to
NoSpanking-subscribe@yahoogroups.com.
